answers.Answer:
Redbox uses state-of-the-art technology to ensure the privacy of all of your data, and Redbox never shares your information or sells it to third parties. When you open a Redbox account, you'll enter your name, email address, and ZIP code (as well as some email preferences). Redbox uses your email address to send you return confirmations and receipts. You can opt in or out of other communications.

If you use a credit card to pay online, your credit card is stored using Secure Socket Layer (SSL) software to encrypt your data during transmission meeting the Data Security Standard of the credit card industry. For more information on our privacy policy, visit https://www.redbox.com/privacy

With more than 5-billion rentals to date, Redbox is America's leading source for affordable new release movie rentals. Redbox offers DVD, Blu-ray DiscÂ® through the nation's largest network of more than 41,500 conveniently located, self-service entertainment kiosks, and On Demand movies and TV shows, without a subscription. To learn more about our colorful history, visit us at https://about.redbox.com/about-redbox.

Before a box is installed, an analysis of a location's suitability needs to be done. If you would like a box at your location, please complete the form at https://about.redbox.com/request-a-kiosk to start the analysis process.

At this time, we don't have any franchising opportunities.
Keep your eyes on the Redbox. Open positions list at https://jobs.redbox.com. If Redbox is hiring, you'll see it here!
Federal copyright laws prohibit copying or burning rented material.

You can contact the Customer Care team by visiting https://redbox.custhelp.com/app/chat or by calling 1-866-REDBOX3 (1-866-733-2693). Customer care is available 7 days a week from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 a.m. Central Time.
You can read the Redbox terms and conditions by visiting https://www.redbox.com/rentalterms.
